name: Dctc
body:
14:14 clement@MacBook-Air-de-Clement ~/code/dctc/packager% vi create-dctc-selfextracting.sh 
dctc is a tool to ease the manipulation and transfer of files across various storage types.

The following storage systems are supported:
* Regular filesystem
* Hadoop HDFS
* Amazon S3
* Google Cloud Storage
* FTP
* SCP / SFTP

dctc provides various commands to operate on all storage systems.

# Installing dctc

The easiest way to install dctc is to get our standalone binary.
Simply copy and run this from a Terminal window:

```
sh $(curl http://dev.dataiku.com/downloads/dctc/download-dctc)
```

# Quick start

For the S3 and Google Cloud Storage protocols, you first need to add an account to dctc.

For example, run:

```
dctc add-account s3
```

Then, follow the instructions.

Running dctc without any arguments will list the available commands.

Running dctc command --help will detail the usage of the command.

Here are a few examples

```
# List the files and folders in a S3 bucket
dctc ls s3://my-bucket

# Synchronize incrementally a GCS path to a local file
dctc sync gs://my-bucket/my-path target-directory

# Copy a folder from GCS to HDFS, compressing all files to .gz on the way
dctc cp -R -c gs://my-bucket/my-path hdfs:///input-data
```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
